page.title: 07The Cotswold Hunt
page.content: The Cotswold Hunt kennels were built in 1923.It was first in the Whaddon area then it moved to Andoversford.The Cotswold Hunt consists of 105 hounds or 52.5 couples of hounds as they call them.The Cotswold Hunt is a group of men and women who follow behind the hunt.In this they hunt in a 15 mile radius which consists of Northleach,Cirencester,Stroud,Evesham and many others. The hunt is where they catch foxes.There are 14 horses invilved from the Cotswold Hunt.There are many other horses involved which are not connected with the Hunt.When they go out hunting they roughly catch a brace of foxes(3)in a week. The puppies are trained from 6 to 12 months old.They are put out to walk at different farms in the hunting area.
